LOTlib.Examples.CCG package¶

Submodules¶

LOTlib.Examples.CCG.CCGLexicon module¶

LOTlib.Examples.CCG.Shared module¶

class LOTlib.Examples.CCG.Shared.Context(objects, relations)[source]¶

A context stores a list of objects and list of N-ary relations, represented as tuples, as in relations = [ (happy, john), (loved, mary, john) ], with ( *args, function)

relation_(*args)[source]¶
LOTlib.Examples.CCG.Shared.can_compose(a, b)[source]¶

Takes two TYPES, and returns the result of a(b) IF this is not possible (due to the types), return None.

NOTE: No currying, type-raising or anything fancy (yet)

LOTlib.Examples.CCG.Shared.str2sen(s)[source]¶
